pullRequest.body:
Add `mk_coe` and `coe_mk` results to `Algebra/Star/StarAlgHom` in analogy with `RingEquiv`.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

### Import summary

No significant changes to the import graph

### PR summary [ae64441ec3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13267/commits/ae64441ec3a1812f9b5f59ecab7bae5c23270d40)

#### Import changes

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ coe_mk`
`+ mk_coe`
`- mk_coe'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Sorry this has been sitting.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9652544065/job/26622904022)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9652544065/job/26622904432)

we should still have a *version* of this (although the current statement is garbage), but only unbundled one level instead of three. That is, `(⟨e, h₁, h₂⟩ : A ≃⋆[R] B)` where `e : A ≃+* B`. See [RingEquiv.coe_mk](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Equiv.html#RingEquiv.coe_mk) and [RingEquiv.mk_coe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Equiv.html#RingEquiv.mk_coe).

So let's note deprecate.

So, like this?
```
@[simp]
theorem coe_mk (e h₁ h₂) : ⇑(⟨e, h₁, h₂⟩ : A ≃⋆ₐ[R] B) = e := rfl

@[simp]
theorem mk_coe (e : A ≃⋆ₐ[R] B) (e' h₁ h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅ h₆) :
    (⟨⟨⟨e, e', h₁, h₂⟩, h₃, h₄⟩, h₅, h₆⟩ : A ≃⋆ₐ[R] B) = e := ext fun _ => rfl
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Algebra/Star/StarAlgHom): `mk_coe` and `coe_mk` in StarAlgHom

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Star/StarRingHom): Add non-unital star ring homomorphisms
